Situation1: They notice their parents appear more stressed and tired than usual.
Situation2: Your I04iend has misunderstood the tone of your text message and replied sounding hurt. You need to call them right now to explain.
Story: I sat at the kitchen table, watching my mom rub her temples as my dad stared blankly at his coffee. They’d both been quieter lately, sighing more, and I could feel the heaviness in the air. I wanted to ask if they were okay, to sit with them and maybe make them smile, but my phone buzzed again. It was my friend, still upset about the text I’d sent earlier. She thought I was annoyed with her, and her last message was sharp, almost accusing. I knew I needed to call her right away, to clear things up before it got worse. But as I glanced at my parents, I felt torn. They needed me to be present, to show I cared, but my friend needed me too, to explain and fix what I’d accidentally broken. My heart pounded as I tried to figure out who needed me more in this moment, feeling the weight of both worlds pressing in on me.
